results.title: Handling and preserving family records
results.creator_credit: Rodney Crouch, James S. Cable and Cable Crouch Productions
results.brief_description: Presented by a range of conservation experts from the British Public Records office, this program looks at the handling and storage of family documents, books, textiles, photographs, films, recorded tapes and military memorabilia, to avoid deterioration. The use of acid free containers, correct temperature control and ventilation, transport methods as well as information about materials and cleaning practices likely to damage family heirlooms are shown.

results.title: Handle with Care
results.creator_credit: Andrena Finlay, Anna Landa and Paul Cox
results.brief_description: This film sensitively follows two women who have been diagnosed with breast cancer. Using a docu-drama format, the program explains methods of self-examination, reaction to diagnosis, options of treatment available and the emotional demands and needs which arise from a positive diagnosis.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andrena Finlay, Anna Landa and Paul Cox

results.title: Handicrafts of India
results.creator_credit: Krishna Gopal, Ezra Mir and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: Deals with the woodcarving, papiermache and shawl-weaving of Kashmir, the metalwork of Uttar-Pradesh, and the marble modelling of Jaipur.

results.title: Handicrafts instructional films. No. 4. Loom weaving
results.brief_description: In this film we are able to observe one of the students of the Universal School of Handicrafts, USA, threading a small loom, and, following a weaving draft, weaving a pattern.

results.title: Hams that couldn't be cured
results.creator_credit: Walter Lantz, Castle Films and United World Films
results.brief_description: Animated film telling the “Three Little Pigs” tale from the Big Bad Wolf’s point of view, with the pigs as tough jazzing beatniks. Similar to the Warner cartoon “Three Little Bops”.

results.title: Hamlet [Animated]
results.creator_credit: et al, Natalia Orlova, Christopher Grace, Elizabeth Babakhina and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: With two US Emmy Awards, “Shakespeare - Animated tales” has won a vast new audience with its skilful, 30 minute adaptations. This can be used as a companion piece to the study of “Hamlet”, however it is far too succinct a precis to be a useful study piece for serious students of the Bard.
results.creator_credit_for_label: et al, Natalia Orlova, Christopher Grace, Elizabeth Babakhina and BBC-TV

results.title: Hamburger
results.brief_description: Hamburger focuses on the fast food industry; providing an insight into the two largest hamburger chains in the world; MacDonalds and Burger King. These two fast food chains have made a dramatic impact, not only on the food industry itself; but on the social and economic lives of individuals. The fast food market has been revolutionised into an industrial process which has had a serious impact on the environment. A powerful documentary in two episodes: Big Mac” and “International Mincemeat.

results.title: Halprin: collective creativity
results.brief_description: Lawrence Halprin, environmental designer, explains his successful approach designing cities for the care and feeding of people, rather than the care and feeding of automobiles. His “take part” workshops draw people together to create their own consensus of how they want their cities to change or be revitalised

results.title: Halley
results.creator_credit: Terence Murtagh and York Films of England
results.brief_description: Provides a historical look at Halley’s Comet; considers work of Halley; notes popularity of comet watching in eighteenth and nineteenth century and briefly shows how NASA space vehicle “Giotto” will rendezvous with Halley’s comet in 1986.
